intro: Ptychotis ammoides, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, linear leaves. Ptychotis ammoides is well adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
